questions.question: What is the difference between intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors?
options: Intrinsic semiconductors are pure, while extrinsic are doped
Intrinsic semiconductors are doped, while extrinsic are pure
There is no difference between them
Intrinsic semiconductors only have electrons, while extrinsic have both electrons and holes

questions.question: What does the Density of States (DOS) represent in semiconductors?
options: The density of the semiconductor material
The number of dopant atoms
The number of available energy states per unit volume and energy
The number of free electrons

questions.question: What is the Fermi level in a semiconductor?
options: The highest energy level in the valence band
The lowest energy level in the conduction band
The energy level where the probability of electron occupancy is 0.5
The average energy of all electrons

questions.question: How does doping affect the Fermi level in semiconductors?
options: It has no effect on the Fermi level
It always moves the Fermi level to the middle of the bandgap
n-type doping moves the Fermi level closer to the conduction band
p-type doping moves the Fermi level closer to the conduction band

questions.question: What is a degenerate semiconductor?
options: A semiconductor with no free carriers
A heavily doped semiconductor where the Fermi level enters the conduction or valence band
An intrinsic semiconductor
A semiconductor at absolute zero temperature
